intro: Mascarenhasia anceps, commonly known as the Mascarene starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant has a low-growing habit with small, narrow leaves and produces numerous small, clustered flowers. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, saline conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
